page.title: 14Rawdon a caring community
page.content: Physically this is a difficult area for the elderly,but they are well cared for.Comprehensive services and sheltered housing are supplied by Leeds Council.(Details from Dept. of Social Service,110 Merrion Centre,LS2 8QA or Rawdon Library.)Volunteers help with Meals/Books on Wheels,and local groups organise a weekly Darby and Joan club and luncheon club.Rotarians take a small party on a trip monthly, and there is a popular Retired Persons class at Benton Park F.E. Centre. Rawdon and Yeadon Community Care Group provide a good neighbour service for anyone in difficulty.It is to give temporary help in cases of need and in emergencies.Details in Post Office. The school nurse,based at Greenacre Clinic,visits schools regularly to give health eduation,discuss problems and check eyesight and general health.
